result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre L Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andre L Green is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andre L Green was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Andre L Green was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Count 10.
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program if revoked.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Court grants 140 days credit.
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with Home Depot in the City of Waukesha, Target in the City of Waukesha, Walmart in the Village of Pewaukee or any other merchant listed in the Criminal Complaints in cases 22CF114, 22CF563 or 22CF781.

Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Complete a Thinking for a change Course.  Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 30 days of release to Extended Supervision.  

Pay restitution ordered in 22CF458 and 22CF114 as a condition of Extended Supervision/Probation.  Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid driver's license.  Become involved with AA or NA within 30 days of release to Extended Supervision/Probation, attend a minimum of 2 meetings per week and obtain a sponsor within the first 60 days of becoming involved in the program.  No new law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Restitution in the amount of $1,559.97 for Target in the City of Waukesha (regarding case 22CF562)  $956 for Walmart in the Village of Pewaukee (regarding case 22CF781) to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision/Probation.
Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision/Probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision/Probation. 

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Muskego Police Department.

Transcript fee to be forwarded to the Waukesha Co District Attorney's office.

1:46 PM Defendant Andre L Green in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Andre L Green.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 and 10.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 1 is dismissed by operation of law.  Count 7 is dismissed and read in.  Cases 22CF563, 22CF781, 22CF1060 and 22CF1471 are dismissed and read in to 22CF114 and 22CF458.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 2:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
36 Months Imprisonment CONSECUTIVE to Count 10
-	18 Months of Initial Confinement
-	18 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program if revoked
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program if revoked

Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	Same as Conditions of Extended Supervision in Count 10

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid probation and extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


Count 10:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 140 Days)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	No contact with Home Depot in the City of Waukesha, Target in the City of Waukesha, Walmart in the Village of Pewaukee or any other merchant listed in the criminal complaints in 22CF114, 22CF563 or 22CF781;
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Complete a Thinking for a Change Course;
-	Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 30 days of release to extended supervision;
-	Pay restitution ordered in 22CF458 and 22CF114 as a condition of extended supervision and probation;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License;
-	Become involved with AA or NA within 30 days of release to extended supervision/probation, attend a minimum of 2 meetings per week and obtan a sponsor withing the first 60 days of becoming involved in the program;
-	No new law violations;

RESTITUTION: $ 1559.97 to be paid to Target in the City of Waukesha (for 22CF562); $ 956.00 to be paid to Walmart in the Village of Pewaukee (for 22CF781)

FINE:  $ 1632.00 (includes IID Surcharge)

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $ 29.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Muskego Police Department.

TRANSCRIPT FEE: $ 16.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the District Attorney's Office.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

AODA Assessment and follow through	

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

08:27 AM Defendant Andre L Green in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Muskego Police Department Patrol Sergeant Peter Lynkiewicz sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Campbell.  Cross examination by Attorney Hughes.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Hughes objects to bind over without argument.  Court finds probable cause as to Counts 1 & 2 to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  The Court will dismiss Counts 3, 5, & 6 as Count 4 was previously dismissed on defense's motion.  State to file an information.  Attorney Hughes notes he previously filed a bail motion so he would be asking for an arraignment date and bail hearing before the Trial Court as soon as possible.
